in school.  C++ and C# I am using daily.  I'm willing to answer what
questions I can, though I haven't had a look at the openglad code at all.

daysoftomorrow wrote:
> I have a particularly interesting challenge, though the programmers on
> this project don't have to do it. 
> I am a computer programming student (possibly my major) and I am
> trying to port OpenGlad to Java. 
>  
> I have never used C or C++, so this will be interesting but difficult. 
>  
> If there is anyone on these forums who has programmed in both
> languages, or C# and C++, I would like your 
> help on this challenge. I believe that as soon as I understand how to
> port the program then I will also 
> be able to help with the development of OpenGlad-e. 
> 
> 
> -------days of tomorrow-------
> 
>
